Msrch 27, 1951
Ur* Burton Pc.ulu
Radio Station 101012
University of Uinnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burtons
Thanks for your note, the flier on the fall meeting, and
the revised list of members. I have had the material for the
brochure in Si1 s hands a couple of weeks but he has not yet
returned it. Re feels that we should have an up-to-date list
whereas Griffith thinks it would not be desirable to do so. I
should appreciate your vote on the subject*
As for the convention, I vote for Friday, Saturday, and
Sunday—three days should be enough—and suggest you reserve
all of the Renter’s sleeping accomodations. I believe we*11
have at least sixty-six people x'egistered and I, for one, feel
that we can and should ignore the football game* It is too
far for most of us to travel to waste time seeing a football
gams after wegget there. I can*t afford to be away from home
any more than is absolutely necessary to take care of business
Congratulations upon the last Newsletter. It was indeed
excellent. You continue to amaze me" by your efficiency.
Sincerely yours.
Graydon Auaraus,
Vice-President
IIAEB
GA/ns
enc. 1
